settings.heading: Stewardship
settings.heading2: At Edwin USA, we [re]create tomorrow’s classics with respect for people and our planet by blending human creativity with cutting edge technology. Because we believe that fashion actually can make the world a better place.

settings.title: PEOPLE
settings.text: Edwin is a human-centric brand with the belief that business should be a force for good. Our foundation is built on concepts of respect, protection, empowerment, and collaboration.

settings.title: TECHNOLOGY
settings.text: At Edwin, cutting edge innovation and state of the art machinery, combined with human creativity serve as backbone for our design and manufacturing process.  Our products are designed and manufactured at Saitex USA, the world's first Industry 4.0 smart factory, which opened in 2021 in Los Angeles. This facility harnesses applied AI, machine & deep learning, IoT, RFID, and robotics to ensure transparent, traceable, responsible production and consumption.

settings.title: OUR PLAN[ET]
settings.text: MANY BRANDS MAY SAY THEY’RE SUSTAINABLE—ALL WHILE GREENWASHING THEIR WASTEFUL HABITS AND PROCESSES. AT EDWIN, WE PRACTICE WHAT WE PREACH. Soil, water, and air are bases for all life on earth and this is why we design our operations with respect for these precious resources. [Re]creating tomorrow’s classics with this ethos requires clean inputs and responsible outputs. To achieve this, we meticulously design our processes and rigorously select materials for our fibers, chemicals, trims, and packaging. Our production takes place in vertically integrated, digitally operated facility, featuring closed loop water recycling system. Additionally, to assure we are on the right track, our design and manufacturing are supported by a trusted network of partners, certifying bodies and organizations such as ZDHC, bluesign®, GOTS, GRS,regenagri®, OEKO-TEX®.

settings.heading: OUR HISTORY
settings.heading2:
BORN IN JAPAN,
CUT IN CALIFORNIA,
WORN WORLDWIDE.

settings.text:
Established in Tokyo, Japan, in 1947, the EDWIN brand has always been known for its authenticity, innovation and craftsmanship.

In 1961, inspired by a growing demand, EDWIN (whose company name comes from a creative rearrangement of the letters found in the word "denim") debuted the first made-in-Japan jeans.


By the 1970s, EDWIN had established itself as a pioneer in denim manufacturing, experimenting with wash techniques in the EDWIN Wash House that impacted denim wash processes around the globe. Innovations included ONE WASH, a prewash process to eliminate shrinkage prior to purchase, and OLD WASH, a precursor to stone wash that reproduces faded colors through careful abrasion techniques for a lived-in denim look


Today, EDWIN continues to set the gold standard in denim production, priding itself on the use of exclusive imported and organic fabrics, revolutionary production technologies, state-of-the-art finishing and advancements in design and fit.


The relaunch of EDWIN USA stays true to the roots of EDWIN in quality, fit and innovation in washes. Honoring its heritage while adopting the same pioneering spirit to propel denim manufacturing into new frontiers, EDWIN combines thoughtfully designed jeans and innovation in sustainable manufacturing methods.
